amendatorysection.chaptername: Cities And Villages; Laws Applicable To More Than One And Less Than All Classes
amendatorysection.para: The Legislature recognizes that the more populous cities of the state serve medical, educational, recreational, transportation, and retail needs of the entire state and that infrastructure costs and needs are great. The governing bodies of such cities have a duty to identify projects which benefit from development funds made available by the Legislature. The creation of the City of the Primary Class Development Fund under section 19-102 and the City of the Metropolitan Class Development Fund under section 19-103 shall be used to meet such needs.
